description: From Latin aggressum, past participle of aggredi (“to attack, assail, approach, go to”), from ad (“to”) + gradi (“to walk, go”), from gradus (“step”); see grade.

verbs.description: aggress (third-person singular simple present aggresses, present participle aggressing, simple past and past participle aggressed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, construed with on) To commit the first act of hostility or offense against; to begin a quarrel or controversy with someone; to make an attack against someone.
